title: Getting Started with Next.js
summary: Learn the basics of Next.js and how to build modern web applications with React.

body.raw:
# Getting Started with Next.js

Next.js is a powerful React framework that makes it easy to build production-ready web applications. In this post, we'll explore the key features and benefits of Next.js.

## What is Next.js?

Next.js is a React framework that provides:

- **Server-Side Rendering (SSR)**: Better SEO and performance
- **Static Site Generation (SSG)**: Pre-rendered pages for optimal speed
- **API Routes**: Build backend functionality alongside your frontend
- **File-based Routing**: Intuitive routing system
- **Built-in CSS Support**: Styled-jsx, CSS modules, and more

## Key Features

### 1. File-based Routing

Next.js uses the file system to define routes. Create a file in the `pages` directory, and it automatically becomes a route.

### 2. API Routes

You can create API endpoints by adding files to the `pages/api` directory.

### 3. Image Optimization

The `next/image` component automatically optimizes images for better performance.

## Getting Started

To create a new Next.js project:

```bash
npx create-next-app@latest my-app
cd my-app
npm run dev
```

This will start your development server at `http://localhost:3000`.

## Conclusion

Next.js is an excellent choice for building modern web applications. Its powerful features and developer experience make it a popular choice among React developers.

Happy coding!

structuredData.headline: Getting Started with Next.js
structuredData.description: Learn the basics of Next.js and how to build modern web applications with React.

title: Photography Tips for Beginners
summary: Essential photography tips to help you capture better photos and improve your skills.

body.raw:
# Photography Tips for Beginners

Photography is an art form that combines technical knowledge with creative vision. Here are some essential tips to help you get started on your photography journey.

## Understanding Your Camera

### 1. Learn the Exposure Triangle

The exposure triangle consists of three key elements:

- **Aperture**: Controls depth of field and light intake
- **Shutter Speed**: Controls motion blur and light intake
- **ISO**: Controls sensor sensitivity and image noise

### 2. Master Manual Mode

While automatic modes are convenient, learning manual mode gives you complete control over your images.

## Composition Techniques

### Rule of Thirds

Divide your frame into nine equal parts using two horizontal and two vertical lines. Place your subject along these lines or at their intersections.

### Leading Lines

Use natural or man-made lines to guide the viewer's eye through your image.

### Framing

Use elements in your environment to frame your subject and draw attention to it.

## Lighting Tips

### Golden Hour

The hour after sunrise and before sunset provides the most flattering natural light.

### Avoid Harsh Midday Sun

Direct sunlight at noon creates harsh shadows and blown-out highlights.

## Practice Makes Perfect

The best way to improve your photography is to practice regularly. Take your camera everywhere and experiment with different techniques.

## Conclusion

Photography is a journey of continuous learning. Start with these basics and gradually develop your own style and techniques.

Remember: the best camera is the one you have with you!

structuredData.headline: Photography Tips for Beginners
structuredData.description: Essential photography tips to help you capture better photos and improve your skills.

title: Welcome to My Blog
summary: This is the first post on my personal blog. Welcome!

body.raw:
# Welcome to My Blog

This is my first blog post! I'm excited to share my thoughts and experiences with you.

## What You Can Expect

In this blog, I'll be writing about:

- **Technology**: My experiences with web development, programming, and new technologies
- **Photography**: Tips, techniques, and stories behind my photos
- **Life**: Personal reflections and experiences

## Getting Started

This blog is built with Next.js and uses MDX for content. You can create new posts by adding `.mdx` files to the `data/blog/` directory.

### Features

- **Markdown Support**: Write in Markdown with MDX components
- **Syntax Highlighting**: Code blocks with syntax highlighting
- **Responsive Design**: Works great on all devices
- **Dark Mode**: Automatic dark/light mode switching

Thanks for reading, and I hope you enjoy the content!

structuredData.headline: Welcome to My Blog
structuredData.description: This is the first post on my personal blog. Welcome!
